title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket to launch record-breaking communications satellite
summary: A report on the latest in a long line of SpaceX launches significantly delayed by customer payload readiness has been updated to...

title: Maxar to compensate Echostar for Jupiter 3 delays
summary: Echostar said Nov. 22 that Maxar Technologies is providing compensation for production issues that have delayed the launch of its Jupiter 3 satellite to at least the first half of 2023.

title: Launch preps underway for first of up to five Falcon Heavy missions this year
summary: SpaceX is set to kick off a busy week of launch preparations at Kennedy Space Center for the first of five planned Falcon Heavy rocket missions this year, targeting a dusk departure no earlier than Thursday evening from Launch Complex 39A on a flight for the U.S. Space Force.

title: Hughes unveils Jupiter 3
summary: Hughes Network System unveiled Jupiter 3, a massive geostationary communications satellite built by Maxar Technologies.

title: EchoStar has fingers crossed for August Falcon Heavy launch
summary: EchoStar said its long-awaited Jupiter 3 satellite should be ready for a Falcon Heavy launch in August, although its deployment faces further delays if a higher priority government project takes this window.

title: SpaceX gears up for Falcon Heavy launch
summary: SpaceX is targeting no earlier than Wednesday, July 26th, for the launch of the Jupiter 3/Echostar XXIV communications satellite from Launch Complex...

title: Launch roundup: Falcon Heavy to launch largest GEO satellite, Rocket Lab’s Electron to complete 40th flight
summary: The week of July 24 through July 30 will end the month with at least four more launches, focused mostly on increasing the number of Earth-imaging satellites sent to space. Firstly, China will launch a currently unknown payload atop the Chang Zheng 2D. The Earth-imaging satellites include the Singapore government’s latest synthetic aperture radar (SAR) payload launching from India and the first of Capella Space’s Acadia satellites launching from New Zealand with Rocket Lab. Dubbed the “We Love the Nightlife“ mission, it will mark Electron’s 40th launch into space.

title: Falcon Heavy second attempt at largest ever geostationary satellite launch now Friday
summary: Ahead of what will be its third flight this year, Falcon Heavy is being prepared for the record-breaking launch of EchoStar 24. Also known as Jupiter 3, this payload will be the heaviest satellite launched to a geostationary transfer orbit, massing 9.2 tonnes. As such, Falcon Heavy will need to expend its center core to gain additional performance, like what has been done on several recent missions.

title: SpaceX came close to breaking a 56-year rocket record with back-to-back launches
summary: SpaceX on Thursday night came close to breaking a record that’s stood for over half a century, with back-to-back launches that had been set to fly from Florida’s Space Coast.

title: SpaceX delays Falcon Heavy, moves forward with Starlink launch
summary: SpaceX delayed the Falcon Heavy Echostar XXIV/Jupiter 3 mission by 24 hours and will move forward with a Falcon 9 Starlink launch...
